headline: Karen Carney awarded OBE in King’s Birthday Honours List
summary: Karen Carney, Cheryl Foster, Kay Cossington and Patricia Gregory receive awards in King’s Birthday Honours List for 2024. A former England international of 144 caps who is now a sports broadcaster and columnist, Carney is […]

headline: Southampton FC Women sign Wales international Rachel Rowe
summary: Southampton have signed Welsh international attacking midfielder Rachel Rowe following her departure from Rangers. The 31-year-old who has over 60 caps for her country, spent eight years at Reading before joining Rangers, with whom she […]

headline: France leapfrog England in FIFA/Cola-Cola Women’s World Ranking
summary: While Spain remain top in the latest FIFA/Cola-Cola Women’s World Ranking, France take second position from England. Spain increased their lead to reach their highest-ever points total as France went second for the first time, […]

headline: Washington Spirit to sign Esme Morgan from Man City Women
summary: Esme Morgan is to join NWSL side Washington Spirit from Manchester City next month in a four-year deal.  The England international who was in squad for the 2023 World Cup, spent all her seven seasons […]

headline: Rangers FC Women sign Laura Rafferty from Southampton
summary: Rangers FC Women have signed 28-year-old defender Laura Rafferty from Championship side Southampton on a two-year deal. A Northern Ireland international with over 30 caps, Rafferty has had spells with Chelsea, Oxford United, Bristol City and […]

headline: Sam Kerr signs new contract with Chelsea Women
summary: Australian striker Sam Kerr has signed a new deal with Chelsea which will keep her with the Blues until the summer of 2026. The 30-year-old joined Chelsea in the 2019/20 season but saw her most […]

headline: Mollie Rouse leaves Sunderland Women for Spokane Zephyr
summary: Midfielder Mollie Rouse has left Sunderland to return to the States with Spokane Zephyr FC in the new USL Super League. The 25-year-old, who has been capped by England up to U-21 level, had a […]

headline: Arsenal Women’s Laura Wienroither signs new contract
summary: Arsenal’s 25-year-old Austrian international defender Laura Wienroither has signed a new contract, as she closes in on 50 appearances for the Gunners. She joined from TSG 1899 Hoffenheim in January 2022 but missed much of […]
